title: Giotto image tools
text: Giotto uses giottoLargeImage represent images raster information. S4 class built based terra SpatRaster. older class called giottoImage based magick package also exists, currently phased . Ideally, giottoLargeImages also renamed giottoImage afterwards, simplifying naming scheme. object structure giottoLargeImage
code: giottoLargeImage \- name                (object name) \- raster_object       (terra raster object) \- extent              (current spatial extent) \- overall_extent      (spatial extent of original image - experimental) \- scale_factor        (pixels per coordinate unit - experimental) \- resolution          (coordinate units covered per pixel) \- max_intensity       (approximate maximum intensity value) \- min_intensity       (approximate minimum intensity value) \- max_window          (value to set as maximum intensity in color scaling) \- colors              (vector of color mappings provided as hex codes) \- is_int              (whether values are integers) \- file_path           (filepath to the image) \- OS_platform         (operating system)

title: Giotto image tools
text: Spatial images often extremely large files. high detail (resolution), large spatial region captured, precision recorded values (bitdepth) often results files 10s gigabytes. makes full size images difficult work . One way get around perform regular sampling image, touching values original image needed generate downscaled representation. implemented terra spatSample(). plotting, Giotto optimizes speed sampling striking balance terra::crop() terra::spatSample() try prevent sampling unnecessary regions, also avoid large crop operations fullsize image, can costly. done plot_auto_largeImage_resample() giottoLargeImages can also resampled image formats (magick EBImage) addition data.table array using GiottoClass:::.spatraster_sample_values() two functions experimental exported using common function names future.

title: Giotto image tools
text: distGiottoImage() can used look values present within giottoLargeImage. often case values recorded within image map full set values allowed bitdepth. Giotto plots images guessing bitdepth based estimated maximum value detected. mapping may always optimal.   Since values beyond 70, try setting max_window 70 color mapping better represents available information.  colormap use image can also edited. default greyscale image monochrome black white. color scales can supplied. monochrome colorscales: getMonochromeColors()
code: library(GiottoClass) gimg <- GiottoData::loadSubObjectMini("giottoLargeImage", idx = 2) gimg <- GiottoClass:::.update_giotto_image(gimg) # update older images that are missing slots  plot(gimg) distGiottoImage(giottoLargeImage = gimg) gimg@max_window <- 70 plot(gimg) # plot(gimg, max_intensity = 150) # can be used without setting the slot gimg@colors <- getMonochromeColors("green") plot(gimg) viridis_colors <- hcl.colors(256, palette = "viridis") plot(gimg, col = viridis_colors) # can be used without setting the slot

title: Overview
text: Giotto 3.0 update introduced S4 subobjects used within giotto object processing. subobjects provide formalized definitions information formatting needed giotto object slots order functional. objects standalone extensible commonly used spatial manipulation plotting methods implemented . addition, subobjects carry several pieces metadata additional slots alongside main information (e.g. also slots spat_unit feat_type alongside exprDT slot exprObj S4). makes nesting information retained taken giotto object nesting information need supplied anymore interacting setter functions. getter functions now output param defaults extracting information giotto object S4 subobject. extracting information modified returned giotto object, preferred information extracted S4 tagged information lost, convenient work S4’s main data slot [ [<- generics.

title: Overview
text: directly creating subobject, constructor functions can used. constructors createExprObj() createCellMetaObj() createFeatMetaObj() createDimObj() createNearestNetObj() createSpatLocsObj() createSpatNetObj() createSpatEnrObj() createSpatialGrid() createGiottoPoints() createGiottoPolygonsFromDfr() createGiottoPolygonsFromMask() createGiottoImage() createGiottoLargeImage() non numeric integer columns spatial location input column position(s): 3 first non-numeric column considered cell ID test consistency expression matrix. non numeric columns removed
code: coords <- data.table::data.table(     sdimx = c(1, 2, 3),     sdimy = c(1, 2, 3),     cell_ID = c("A", "B", "C") )  st <- createSpatLocsObj(     name = "test",     spat_unit = "cell",     coordinates = coords,     provenance = "cell" ) ## There are non numeric or integer columns for the spatial location ##  input at column position(s): 3 ##  The first non-numeric column will be considered as a cell ID ##  to test for consistency with the expression matrix ##  Other non numeric columns will be removed print(st) ## An object of class spatLocsObj : "test" ## spat_unit : "cell" ## provenance: cell  ## dimensions: 3 3  ## preview   : ##    sdimx sdimy cell_ID ##    <num> <num>  <char> ## 1:     1     1       A ## 2:     2     2       B ## 3:     3     3       C ##  ## ranges: ##      sdimx sdimy ## [1,]     1     1 ## [2,]     3     3

title: Overview
text: Giotto provides getter setter functions manually accessing information contained within giotto object. Note setters require data provided compatible S4 subobjects lists thereof. External data can read appropriate formats using reader functions. getter functions return S4 subobjects default. getters getExpression() getCellMetadata() getFeatMetadata() getSpatialLocations() getDimReduction() getNearestNetwork() getSpatialNetwork() getPolygonInfo() getFeatureInfo() getSpatialEnrichment() getGiottoImage() setters setExpression() setCellMetadata() setFeatureMetadata() setSpatialLocations() setDimReduction() setNearestNetwork() setSpatialNetwork() setPolygonInfo() setFeatureInfo() setSpatialEnrichment() setGiottoImage()

text: spatUnit(), featType(), prov() replacement functions tagged spatial unit, feature type, provenance information respectively.
code: # spat_unit spatUnit(expval) <- "new_spat" spatUnit(expval) ## [1] "new_spat" # feat_type featType(expval) <- "new_feat" featType(expval) ## [1] "new_feat" # provenance prov(expval) <- "cell" prov(expval) ## [1] "cell"

title: Giotto spatial geometry classes
text: GiottoClass represents spatial polygons points respectively S4 classes giottoPolygon giottoPoints. objects built top terra SpatVectors order represent spatial biology. also respond many terra’s generics, enhancements. objects spatVector slot contains main information. common slot inherited VIRTUAL terraVectData class, however naming may subject change data representations added. structures classes : note unique_ID_cache slots used get around memory usage incurred frequently accessing SpatVectors attributes. caches updated modifications object. automatically performed using [] subsetting.
code: terraVectData \- spatVector  giottoPolygon \- spatVector           (spatial polygons SpatVector) \- spatVectorCentroids  (centroids points SpatVector) \- overlaps             (list of overlapped features info) \- name                 (object name/spat_unit) \- unique_ID_cache      (cache of polygon IDs)  giottoPoints \- spatVector           (spatial points SpatVector) \- networks             (feature network) \- feat_type            (object name/feat_type) \- unique_ID_cache      (cache of feature IDs)

title: Giotto spatial geometry classes
text: createGiottoPolygon() accepts number inputs, including filepaths spatial files .wkt, .shp, .GeoJSON mask image files common formats .tif .png. reading files, passed respective methods SpatVector SpatRaster (mask image). data.frame-like inputs also allowed long formatted similarly terra’s matrix representation polygon geometries, least following columns. geom: integer identifier polygon part: integer identifier part polygon, case multi polygon x: numeric x coordinate polygon vertex y: numeric y coordinate polygon vertex hole: integer identifier hole within polygon poly_ID: standard Giotto identifier polygon. Akin cell_ID Additional columns can included attributes, set poly_IDs required. de-novo generation simple polygon arrays, see documentation polyStamp() tessellate()

title: Giotto spatial geometry classes
text: relatively fewer input methods giottoPoints since currently tend provided flat files opposed spatial-specific formats. createGiottoPoints() works data.frame-like inputs least columns x-coordinate, y-coordinate, ID information. first two detected numeric columns expected x y respectively. first character column assumed feat_IDs. terra SpatVector inputs also accepted. helpful parameter split_keyword accepts list regex keywords pull matched features separate giottoPoints objects. useful situations multiple feature modalities /QC targets provided together interfere analyzed together. (see examples createGiottoPoints() documentation)

title: Giotto spatial geometry classes
text: GiottoClass set functions converting giottoPoints giottoPolygon objects spatial classes using .sf(), .sp(), .stars(), .terra(). terra-based giottoPoints giottoPolygon objects can also converted data.table geometry manipulation. method largely piggybacks terra’s .data.frame() adds support geom = "XY" polygon geometry. tables can either re-ingested using createGiottoPolygon() createGiottoPoints() converted SpatVector using .polygons() .points()

title: Giotto spatial geometry classes
text: Centroids information carried giottoPolygon objects spatVectorCentroids slot. centroids() generic terra pulls slot information already exists. Otherwise, calculates returns set centroids polygons SpatVector points. append_gpolygon param makes giottoPolygon centroids info appended returned instead.

title: Giotto spatial geometry classes
text: Overlaps sets features overlapped polygons. calculateOverlaps() generic function performs overlapping polygons points polygons raster (intensity) data. Overlaps stored list giottoPolygon overlaps slot, separated modalities. list can retrieved using overlaps(). case overlapped points geometries, list items points SpatVector objects. poly_ID column tracks polygon overlapping point feature designated feat_ID feat_ID_uniq. NA values mean feature overlapped. overlaps intensities, results stored data.tables nested list called intensity main overlaps list.

title: Giotto spatial geometry classes
text: Overlap results can converted expression matrices using overlapToMatrix()
code: # points, rna modality (default) rna_mat <- overlapToMatrix(gpoly) ## Warning: [overlapToMatrix] expected col_names and row_names ##  not provided together. what: Giotto Suite object definitions and framework
title: Giotto Suite object definitions and framework
text: package contains Giotto object subobject class definitions frameworks. Functionalities relating data ingestion, basic object creation, data access within Giotto object, generics defined Giotto classes found . Applications framework convenience functions loading specific technologies found base Giotto package.

title: Giotto Suite object definitions and framework
text: can install GiottoClass like:
code: library(devtools) install_github('drieslab/GiottoClass')

title: Spatial coordinates — XY
code: # S4 method for class 'spatLocsObj' XY(x, ...)  # S4 method for class 'spatLocsObj,matrix' XY(x) <- value  # S4 method for class 'giottoPoints' XY(x, ...)  # S4 method for class 'giottoPoints,ANY' XY(x, ...) <- value  # S4 method for class 'giottoPolygon' XY(x, ...)  # S4 method for class 'giottoPolygon,ANY' XY(x, ...) <- value  # S4 method for class 'SpatVector' XY(x, include_geom = FALSE, ...)  # S4 method for class 'SpatVector,matrix' XY(x, ...) <- value

title: Spatial coordinates — XY
text: x object ... additional args pass value matrix. xy(z) coordinates set include_geom logical. Whether geom, part, hole terra geometry matrix included.

title: Spatial coordinates — XY
text: XY() returns matrix. XY<-() returns class x

title: Add cell metadata — addCellMetadata
text: gobject giotto object spat_unit spatial unit feat_type feature type new_metadata new cell metadata use (data.table, data.frame, vector, factor, ...) vector_name (optional) custom name new metadata column single vector factor provided by_column merge metadata based cell_ID column pDataDT (default = FALSE) column_cell_ID column name new metadata use by_column = TRUE

title: Add cell metadata — addCellMetadata
text: giotto object

title: Add cell metadata — addCellMetadata
text: can add additional cell metadata several manners: 1. Provide data.frame-like object, vector, factor cell annotations order cell_ID column pDataDT(gobject). bit risky recommended. 2. Provide data.frame-like object cell annotations specify column contains cell IDs, cell IDs need match cell_ID column pDataDT(gobject) 3. Provide vector factor named cell IDs correspond . names matched cell_ID column pDataDT(gobject).

title: Add cell metadata — addCellMetadata
code: g <- GiottoData::loadGiottoMini("visium") #> 1. read Giotto object #> 2. read Giotto feature information #> 3. read Giotto spatial information #> 3.1 read Giotto spatial shape information #> 3.2 'giotto_env' #>  python version : 3.10 #> checking default envname 'giotto_env' #> a system default python environment was found #> Using python path: #>  "/usr/share/miniconda/envs/giotto_env/bin/python"  m <- pDataDT(g) m <- m[, c("cell_ID", "leiden_clus")] m$cell_type <- paste0("cell_type_", m$leiden_clus) m <- m[, c("cell_ID", "cell_type")]  g <- addCellMetadata(     g,     new_metadata = m,     by_column = TRUE,     column_cell_ID = "cell_ID" )  pDataDT(g) #>                 cell_ID in_tissue nr_feats perc_feats total_expr leiden_clus #> title: addGiottoImage — addGiottoImage
text: gobject gobject add images objects images list giotto images add largeImages deprecated spat_loc_name provide spatial location slot Giotto align giottoImages. Defaults first one scale_factor provide scale image pixel dimensions relative spatial coordinates. negative_y Map image negative y spatial values TRUE automatic alignment. Meaning origin upper left instead lower left.

title: Affine transformations — affine
code: # S4 method for class 'giotto,matrix' affine(   x,   y,   inv = FALSE,   spat_unit = ":all:",   feat_type = ":all:",   images = ":all:",   ... )  # S4 method for class 'missing,missing' affine(x)  # S4 method for class 'ANY,missing' affine(x)  # S4 method for class 'ANY,affine2d' affine(x, y, ...)  # S4 method for class 'SpatVector,matrix' affine(x, y, inv = FALSE, ...)  # S4 method for class 'giottoPoints,matrix' affine(x, y, inv = FALSE, ...)  # S4 method for class 'giottoPolygon,matrix' affine(x, y, inv = FALSE, ...)  # S4 method for class 'spatLocsObj,matrix' affine(x, y, inv = FALSE, ...)  # S4 method for class 'giottoLargeImage,matrix' affine(x, y, inv = FALSE, ...)  # S4 method for class 'giottoAffineImage,matrix' affine(x, y, inv = FALSE, ...)  # S4 method for class 'affine2d,matrix' affine(x, y, inv = FALSE, ...)

title: Affine transformations — affine
text: x object affine transform matrix y matrix coercible matrix (affine2d). matrix either 2 3 columns (linear affine). inv logical. Whether inverse affine transform applied. spat_unit character vector. spatial units affect. :: token affect can used. feat_type character vector. feature types affect. :: token affect can used. images character vector. Images affect. :: token affect can used. ... additional args pass (none implemented)

title: Affine transformations — affine
text: affine transformed object affine2d matrix passed x

title: Affine transformations — affine
code: m <- diag(rep(1, 3)) trans_m <- matrix(c(1, 0, 0, 0, 1, 0, 200, 300, 1), nrow = 3) scale_m <- matrix(c(2, 0, 0, 0, 3, 0, 0, 0, 1), nrow = 3) aff_m <- matrix(c(2, 3, 0, 0.2, 3, 0, 100, 29, 1), nrow = 3)  gpoints <- GiottoData::loadSubObjectMini("giottoPoints") gpoly <- GiottoData::loadSubObjectMini("giottoPolygon") sl <- GiottoData::loadSubObjectMini("spatLocsObj")  # creation of affine2d aff <- affine(m) aff <- spin(flip(shear(aff, fx = 0.2)), 45) plot(aff) # blue is start, red is end   # giottoPoints ############################################## plot(gpoints)  plot(affine(gpoints, trans_m))   # giottoPolygon ############################################# plot(gpoly)  plot(affine(gpoly, scale_m))  plot(affine(gpoly, aff)) # affine() with `affine2d`   # spatLocsObj ############################################### plot(affine(sl, m))  plot(affine(sl, trans_m))  plot(affine(sl, scale_m))  # this transformation can be inverted aff_sl <- affine(sl, aff_m) plot(aff_sl)  plot(affine(aff_sl, aff_m, inv = TRUE))

title: Calculate features overlapped by polygons — calculateOverlap
text: x Object spatial annotations: giottoPolygon, SpatVector polygons. Can also giotto object name_overlap name overlap results (default feat_info parameter) spatial_info character. Name polygon information feat_info character. Name vector feature information overlap image_names character vector. Name(s) image feature information overlap poly_subset_ids character vector. (optional) Specific poly_IDs use return_gobject return giotto object (default: TRUE) verbose verbose ... additional params pass methods. y Object features overlap: giottoPoints, giottoLargeImage, SpatVector points SpatRaster feat_subset_column character. (optional) feature info attribute subset feature points performing overlap calculation. feat_subset_ids (optional) values matched feat_subset_column order subset feature points performing overlap calculation. count_info_column character. (optional) column count information. Useful cases one detection reported per point. return_gpolygon default = TRUE. Whether return entire giottoPolygon provided x, overlaps information appended bare terra SpatVector

title: Calculate features overlapped by polygons — calculateOverlap
text: Usually object class x, overlaps information appended. return_* logical params usually allow return lower-level representation results instead. SpatVector,SpatRaster method different returns data.table

text: feat_subset_column, feat_subset_ids, count_info_column specific overlaps feature points info, provided overlapping image data. three params can also passed giotto method ... param working overlaps feature points info.

title: Create a giotto object — createGiottoObject
text: See http://giottosuite.com/articles/getting_started_gobject.html details [Requirements] create giotto object need provide least matrix genes row names cells column names. matrix can provided base matrix, sparse Matrix, data.frame, data.table path . include spatial information cells (regions) need provide matrix, data.table data.frame (path ) coordinates spatial dimensions. can 2D (x y) 3D (x, y, x). row order cell coordinates column order provided expression data. [Instructions] Additionally instruction file, generated manually createGiottoInstructions can provided instructions, default instruction file created Giotto object. [Multiple fields] case dataset consists multiple fields, like seqFISH+ example, offset file can provided stitch different fields together. stitchFieldCoordinates can used generate offset file. [Processed data] Processed count data, normalized data, can provided using one different expression slots (norm_expr, norm_scaled_expr, custom_expr). [Metadata] Cell gene metadata can provided using cell gene metadata slots. data can also added afterwards using addFeatMetadata addCellMetadata functions. [information] Additional information can provided appropriate slots: spatial networks spatial grids spatial enrichments dimensions reduction nearest neighbours networks images

title: Create giotto polygons object — createGiottoPolygon
text: Create giottoPolygon object used represent spatial annotations polygons. Inputs can structured data.frame object three columns correspond x/y vertices polygon ID additional columns set attributes, spatial file wkt, .shp, .GeoJSON, mask file (e.g. segmentation results).  character method file reading dispatch specific methods based kind data file .

code: # S4 method for class 'character' createGiottoPolygon(x, ...)  # S4 method for class 'SpatVector' createGiottoPolygon(x, name = "cell", calc_centroids = FALSE, verbose = TRUE)  # S4 method for class 'SpatRaster' createGiottoPolygon(   x,   name = "cell",   mask_method = c("guess", "single", "multiple"),   remove_background_polygon = FALSE,   background_algo = c("range"),   fill_holes = TRUE,   poly_IDs = NULL,   ID_fmt = "cell_",   flip_vertical = TRUE,   shift_vertical_step = TRUE,   flip_horizontal = TRUE,   shift_horizontal_step = TRUE,   remove_unvalid_polygons = TRUE,   calc_centroids = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE )  # S4 method for class 'data.frame' createGiottoPolygon(   x,   name = "cell",   calc_centroids = FALSE,   skip_eval_dfr = FALSE,   copy_dt = TRUE,   verbose = TRUE )  createGiottoPolygonsFromMask(   maskfile,   mask_method = c("guess", "single", "multiple"),   name = "cell",   remove_background_polygon = FALSE,   background_algo = c("range"),   fill_holes = TRUE,   poly_IDs = NULL,   ID_fmt = "cell_",   flip_vertical = TRUE,   shift_vertical_step = TRUE,   flip_horizontal = TRUE,   shift_horizontal_step = TRUE,   calc_centroids = FALSE,   remove_unvalid_polygons = TRUE,   verbose = FALSE )  createGiottoPolygonsFromDfr(   segmdfr,   name = "cell",   calc_centroids = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE,   skip_eval_dfr = FALSE,   copy_dt = TRUE )  createGiottoPolygonsFromGeoJSON(   GeoJSON,   name = "cell",   calc_centroids = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Create giotto polygons object — createGiottoPolygon
text: x input. Filepath .GeoJSON mask image file. Can also data.frame vertex 'x', 'y', 'poly_ID' information. ... additional params pass. character method, params pass SpatRaster SpatVector methods, depending whether x filepath maskfile spatial file (ex: wkt, shp, GeoJSON) respectively. name name giottoPolygon object created calc_centroids (default FALSE) calculate centroids polygons verbose verbose mask_method mask file defines individual segmentation annotations. See mask_method section remove_background_polygon try remove background polygon (default: FALSE) background_algo algorithm remove background polygon fill_holes fill holes within created polygons poly_IDs character vector. Default = NULL. Custom unique names polygon mask file. ID_fmt character. applied poly_IDs = NULL. Naming scheme poly_IDs. Default = "cell_". See ID_fmt section. flip_vertical flip mask figure vertical manner shift_vertical_step shift vertical (boolean numerical) flip_horizontal flip mask figure horizontal manner shift_horizontal_step shift horizontal (boolean numerical) remove_unvalid_polygons remove unvalid polygons (default: TRUE) skip_eval_dfr (default FALSE) skip evaluation provided dataframe copy_dt (default TRUE) segmdfr provided dt, determines whether copy made maskfile path mask file, terra SpatRaster, data class readable terra::rast() segmdfr data.frame-like object polygon coordinate information (x, y, poly_ID) x y vertex information polygon referenced poly_ID. See details columns selected coordinate ID information. GeoJSON path .GeoJSON file

title: Create giotto polygons object — createGiottoPolygon
text: determining column within tabular data intended provide polygon information, Giotto first checks column names 'x', 'y', 'poly_ID'. discovered, directly selected. discovered Giotto checks data type columns selects first 'character' type column 'poly_ID' first two 'numeric' columns 'x' 'y' respectively. also unsuccessful poly_ID defaults 3rd column. 'x' 'y' default 1st 2nd columns.

title: Create giotto polygons object — createGiottoPolygon
text: One "single", "multiple", "guess". "single" assumes provided mask image binary, polygon vs background distinct values. kind image, expected generated polygons single multipart polygon. "single" takes multipart polygon breaks apart individual singlepart polygons. initial simple numeric index 'nth' polygon found mask image applied ID (see ID_fmt section). "multiple" assumes provided mask image distinct intensity values specify IDs individual polygons. initial numeric ID applied intensity value pixels made annotation polygon mask image (see ID_fmt section). "guess" examines values image pick likely appropriate method "single" "multiple".

title: Create giotto polygons object — createGiottoPolygon
text: Defaults applying input prefix (using paste0()) numerical ID values detected  mask_method. (ie: ID_fmt = "cell_" produces cell_1, cell_2, cell_3, ...) "%" character detected input input treated sprintf() fmt param input instead. (ie: ID_fmt = "cell_%03d" produces cell_001, cell_002, cell_003, ...)

title: createMetafeats — createMetafeats
text: gobject Giotto object spat_unit spatial unit feat_type feature type expression_values expression values use feat_clusters numerical vector features names stat statistical transformation calculate across cluster features per cell get metafeature value. Provided defaults "mean", 'sum', "max", "min". function  supplied instead, run via apply(MARGIN = 2) across expression matrix calculate  metafeature value. rescale_to numeric vector length 2. (optional) New maximum minimum rescale features calculating metafeature score using stat. Values first zeroed setting minimum value 0, rescaled. cases values across feature, rescale produces middle point range specified rescale_to name name metagene results return_gobject return giotto object verbose verbose

title: createMetafeats — createMetafeats
code: # load a dataset g <- GiottoData::loadGiottoMini("viz") #> 1. read Giotto object #> 2. read Giotto feature information #> 3. read Giotto spatial information #> 3.1 read Giotto spatial shape information #> 3.2 read Giotto spatial centroid information #> 3.3 read Giotto spatial overlap information #> 4. read Giotto image information #> python already initialized in this session #>  active environment : 'giotto_env' #>  python version : 3.10 #> checking default envname 'giotto_env' #> a system default python environment was found #> Using python path: #>  "/usr/share/miniconda/envs/giotto_env/bin/python" # set a spat unit to use activeSpatUnit(g) <- "aggregate"  # define the metafeats # We do this by making a set of annotations. These annotations can be # made as either a vector or data.frame  # 1.1 annotation vector (numeric) feats_to_use <- featIDs(g)[seq_len(6)] clust_to_use1 <- c(1, 1, 1, 2, 2, 2) names(clust_to_use1) <- feats_to_use force(clust_to_use1) #>   Mlc1 Gprc5b   Gfap  Ednrb   Sox9   Aqp4  #>      1      1      1      2      2      2   g <- createMetafeats(     gobject = g,     feat_clusters = clust_to_use1,     name = "metagene_1" ) #> calculating metafeature: 1 #> calculating metafeature: 2  # 1.2 annotation vector (character) clust_to_use2 <- c(rep("sig_a", 3), rep("sig_b", 3)) names(clust_to_use2) <- feats_to_use force(clust_to_use2) #>    Mlc1  Gprc5b    Gfap   Ednrb    Sox9    Aqp4  #> "sig_a" "sig_a" "sig_a" "sig_b" "sig_b" "sig_b"   g <- createMetafeats(     gobject = g,     feat_clusters = clust_to_use2,     name = "metagene_2" ) #> calculating metafeature: sig_a #> calculating metafeature: sig_b  # 2.1 annotation data.frame (no weights) # Cols must be: # `clus` - which metafeature # `feat` - features to assign to this metafeature # `w` - (optional) weight to assign the feature before metafeature score #       calculation clust_to_use3 <- data.frame(     clus = c(rep("sig_a", 3), rep("sig_b", 3)),     feat = feats_to_use ) force(clust_to_use3) #>    clus   feat #> 1 sig_a   Mlc1 #> 2 sig_a Gprc5b #> 3 sig_a   Gfap #> 4 sig_b  Ednrb #> 5 sig_b   Sox9 #> 6 sig_b   Aqp4 g <- createMetafeats(     gobject = g,     feat_clusters = clust_to_use3,     name = "metagene_3" ) #> calculating metafeature: sig_a #> calculating metafeature: sig_b  # 2.1 annotation data.frame (weights) clust_to_use4 <- data.frame(     clus = c(rep("sig_a", 3), rep("sig_b", 3)),     feat = feats_to_use,     w = c(1, 1, 1, 2, 3, 4) ) force(clust_to_use4) #>    clus   feat w #> 1 sig_a   Mlc1 1 #> 2 sig_a Gprc5b 1 #> 3 sig_a   Gfap 1 #> 4 sig_b  Ednrb 2 #> 5 sig_b   Sox9 3 #> 6 sig_b   Aqp4 4 g <- createMetafeats(     gobject = g,     feat_clusters = clust_to_use4,     name = "weighted_metagene" ) #> calculating metafeature: sig_a #> calculating metafeature: sig_b  # 3. Other statistic transforms can be calculated # The default and what has been used so far is just finding the mean g <- createMetafeats(     gobject = g,     feat_clusters = clust_to_use4,     stat = "sum",     expression_values = "raw", # find summed raw expr for these feats     name = "raw_sums" ) #> calculating metafeature: sig_a #> calculating metafeature: sig_b  # 4. A custom stat function can also be supplied # These custom functions must be summary functions, as in, they must # produce only a single numeric output from many custom_stat <- function(x) {     if (max(x) == 0) {         return(0)     }     return(mean(x / max(x))) } g <- createMetafeats(     gobject = g,     feat_clusters = clust_to_use4,     stat = custom_stat,     expression_values = "raw",     name = "raw_custom" ) #> calculating metafeature: sig_a #> calculating metafeature: sig_b  # 5. A rescale of the values to a specified numeric range can be applied # before the stat score calculation. g <- createMetafeats(     gobject = g,     feat_clusters = clust_to_use4,     stat = "mean",     expression_values = "normalized",     rescale_to = c(0, 1),     name = "norm_scaled_mean_metafeat" ) #> calculating metafeature: sig_a #> calculating metafeature: sig_b showGiottoSpatEnrichments(g) #> Spatial unit:  aggregate   #>  #> --> Feature type:  rna   #>  #> ----> Name  cluster_metagene :  #>           1         2         3         4     5 #>       <num>     <num>     <num>     <num> title: createNearestNetwork — createNearestNetwork
text: function creates k-nearest neighbour (kNN) shared nearest neighbour (sNN) network based provided dimension reduction space. run directly gene expression matrix set dim_reduction_to_use = NULL. See also kNN sNN information networks created. Output kNN: : cell_ID source cell : cell_ID target cell distance: distance cells weight: \(1/(1 + distance)\) Output sNN: : cell_ID source cell : cell_ID target cell distance: distance cells weight: \(1/(1 + distance)\) shared: number shared neighbours rank: ranking pairwise cell neighbours sNN networks two additional parameters can set: minimum_shared: minimum number shared neighbours needed top_shared: keep number top shared neighbours, irrespective minimum_shared setting

title: Create a network — createNetwork
code: createNetwork(   x,   type = c("sNN", "kNN", "delaunay"),   method = c("dbscan", "geometry", "RTriangle", "deldir"),   node_ids = NULL,   include_distance = TRUE,   include_weight = TRUE,   as.igraph = TRUE,   verbose = NULL,   ... )

title: Create a network — createNetwork
text: x matrix. Data treat nodes. Examples include expression information, PCA matrix, spatial locations xy(z) coordinates. type type network create. Currently: "sNN", "kNN", "delaunay" method method used create type network requested. One "dbscan" sNN kNN "geometry", "RTriangle", "deldir" delaunay. node_ids character. Node ID values assign. NULL, integer indices used node IDs. include_distance logical. include edge distance attribute output include_weight logical. include edge weight attribute output .igraph logical. Whether return igraph. Otherwise returns data.table verbose verbose. Default = NULL (uses giotto verbosity option) ... additional params pass. See details section

title: Create a network — createNetwork
text: Either igraph .igraph = TRUE data.table otherwise.

title: Create a network — createNetwork
text: Additional params described . Items parenthesis refer network types /methods params specific . [k] numeric. (sNN, kNN) number neighbors find. Default 30 [minimum_shared] numeric. (sNN) minimum shared neighbors allowed per edge [top_shared] numeric. (sNN) keep least many edges per node, kept edges top ranked terms number shared neighbors. [filter] logical. (kNN) whether filter unique edges apply minimum_k maximum_distance filters. set TRUE generating spatial kNN network. Default FALSE. [minimum_k] (delaunay, kNN) minimum nearest neighbours maximum_distance != NULL [maximum_distance] (delaunay, kNN) edge maximum euclidean distance allowed [Y] (RTriangle) TRUE prohibits insertion Steiner points mesh boundary. Default TRUE [j] (RTriangle) TRUE jettisons vertices part final triangulation output. Default TRUE [S] (RTriangle) Specifies maximum number added Steiner points. Default 0 [options] (geometry) default "Pp". See geometry::delaunayn [weight_fun] function calculate weights based distance include_weight = TRUE. Default \(weight = 1 / (1 + distance)\) "kNN" "sNN" types \(weight = 1 / distance\) delaunay type networks

title: Create a network — createNetwork
code: pca <- GiottoData::loadSubObjectMini("dimObj")[] sl <- GiottoData::loadSubObjectMini("spatLocsObj")[]  # Delaunay via geometry::delaunayn() del_geom <- createNetwork(     x = as.matrix(sl[, .(sdimx, sdimy)]),     type = "delaunay",     method = "geometry",     include_weight = TRUE,     weight_fun = function(d) 1 / d,     as.igraph = FALSE,     node_ids = sl$cell_ID )  # Delaunay via RTriangle::triangulate() del_rt <- createNetwork(     x = as.matrix(sl[, .(sdimx, sdimy)]),     type = "delaunay",     method = "RTriangle",     include_weight = TRUE,     weight_fun = function(d) 1 / d,     as.igraph = FALSE,     node_ids = sl$cell_ID )  # Delaunay via deldir::deldir() del_dd <- createNetwork(     x = as.matrix(sl[, .(sdimx, sdimy)]),     type = "delaunay",     method = "deldir",     include_weight = TRUE,     weight_fun = function(d) 1 / d,     as.igraph = FALSE,     node_ids = sl$cell_ID )  # kNN spatial network kNN_spat <- createNetwork(     x = as.matrix(sl[, .(sdimx, sdimy)]),     type = "kNN",     method = "dbscan",     include_weight = TRUE,     weight_fun = function(d) 1 / d, # not the default     as.igraph = FALSE,     node_ids = sl$cell_ID,     k = 4L,     maximum_distance = NULL,     minimum_k = 0L )  # kNN NN network kNN <- createNetwork(     pca[, seq_len(10)],     type = "kNN",     method = "dbscan",     node_ids = rownames(pca),     as.igraph = TRUE )  # sNN NN network sNN <- createNetwork(     pca[, seq_len(10)],     type = "sNN",     method = "dbscan",     node_ids = rownames(pca),     as.igraph = TRUE )  # using defaults for sNN with index IDs to create igraph sNN_idx <- createNetwork(pca[, seq_len(10)])

title: Decompose affine matrix into scale, rotation, and shear operations — decomp_affine
text: Affine transforms linear transformations cover scaling, rotation, shearing, translations. can represented matrices 2x3 3x3 values. function reads matrix extracts values needed perform list class affine. Works 2D transforms. Logic https://math.stackexchange.com//3521141

title: Decompose affine matrix into scale, rotation, and shear operations — decomp_affine

title: Decompose affine matrix into scale, rotation, and shear operations — decomp_affine
text: x object coercible matrix 2x3 3x3 affine matrix

title: Decompose affine matrix into scale, rotation, and shear operations — decomp_affine
text: list transforms information.

title: Decompose affine matrix into scale, rotation, and shear operations — decomp_affine
code: # load example data sl <- GiottoData::loadSubObjectMini("spatLocsObj")  # affine transform matrices m <- diag(rep(1, 3)) shear_m <- trans_m <- m trans_m[seq(2), 3] <- c(200, 300) scale_m <- diag(c(2, 3, 1)) shear_m[2, 1] <- 2 aff_m <- matrix(c(     2, 0.5, 1000,     -0.3, 3, 20,     100, 29, 1 ), nrow = 3, byrow = TRUE)  # create affine objects # values are shown in order of operations affine(m) #> <affine2d> #> anchor    : -180, 180, -90, 90  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> rotate    : 0  (rad) #> shear     : 0, 0  (x, y) #> scale     : 1, 1  (x, y) #> translate : 0, 0  (x, y) affine(trans_m) #> <affine2d> #> anchor    : -180, 180, -90, 90  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> rotate    : 0  (rad) #> shear     : 0, 0  (x, y) #> scale     : 1, 1  (x, y) #> translate : 200, 300  (x, y) affine(scale_m) #> <affine2d> #> anchor    : -180, 180, -90, 90  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> rotate    : 0  (rad) #> shear     : 0, 0  (x, y) #> scale     : 2, 3  (x, y) #> translate : 0, 0  (x, y) s <- affine(shear_m) a <- affine(aff_m) force(a) #> <affine2d> #> anchor    : -180, 180, -90, 90  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> rotate    : -0.165148677414627  (rad) #> shear     : 0.016260162601626, 0  (x, y) #> scale     : 2.02210754385589, 3.04138126514911  (x, y) #> translate : 1000, 20  (x, y)  # perform piecewise transforms with decomp  sl_shear_piecewise <- sl |>     spin(GiottoUtils::degrees(s$rotate), x0 = 0, y0 = 0) |>     shear(fx = s$shear[["x"]], fy = s$shear[["y"]], x0 = 0, y0 = 0) |>     rescale(fx = s$scale[["x"]], fy = s$scale[["y"]], x0 = 0, y0 = 0) |>     spatShift(dx = s$translate[["x"]], dy = s$translate[["y"]])  sl_aff_piecewise <- sl |>     spin(GiottoUtils::degrees(a$rotate), x0 = 0, y0 = 0) |>     shear(fx = a$shear[["x"]], fy = a$shear[["y"]], x0 = 0, y0 = 0) |>     rescale(fx = a$scale[["x"]], fy = a$scale[["y"]], x0 = 0, y0 = 0) |>     spatShift(dx = a$translate[["x"]], dy = a$translate[["y"]])  plot(affine(sl, shear_m))  plot(sl_shear_piecewise) plot(affine(sl, aff_m))  plot(sl_aff_piecewise)

title: Get a SpatExtent — ext
text: x spatial object ... additional params pass spat_unit character. Spatial unit limit search . provided, default set. feat_type character. Feature type limit search "points" information. provided, default set. all_data logical. TRUE (default), spatial information designated prefer searched combined SpatExtent returned. FALSE, SpatExtent first existing data ordered prefer returned. prefer character vector. Order preferred data get extent . allowed terms "polygon", "spatlocs", "points", "images". also default ordering. Omitting terms removes search. name named list. Specific object names check. List names correspond allowed terms prefer. one name allowed "images" moment, produces combined SpatExtent verbose verbose value value set. Accepts object ext() work

title: Get a SpatExtent — ext
text: SpatExtent

title: Get a SpatExtent — ext
code: g <- GiottoData::loadGiottoMini("vizgen") #> 1. read Giotto object #> 2. read Giotto feature information #> 3. read Giotto spatial information #> 3.1 read Giotto spatial shape information #> 3.2 read Giotto spatial centroid information #> 3.3 read Giotto spatial overlap information #> 4. read Giotto image information #> python already initialized in this session #>  active environment : 'giotto_env' #>  python version : 3.10 #> checking default envname 'giotto_env' #> a system default python environment was found #> Using python path: #>  "/usr/share/miniconda/envs/giotto_env/bin/python" # giotto %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%% ext(g) # defaults to checking first giottoPolygon extent #> SpatExtent : 6391.46568586489, 6903.57332779812, -5153.89721175534, -4694.86823300896 (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) ext(g, prefer = "spatlocs") # check first spatLocsObj extent #> SpatExtent : 6401.14818002375, 6899.3228463116, -5147.19306531348, -4700.15708342436 (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) # first spatLocsObj from a different spat_unit ext(g, spat_unit = "aggregate", prefer = "spatlocs") #> SpatExtent : 6401.41164725267, 6899.10802819571, -5146.74746408943, -4700.32590047134 (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax)  # from first image object ext(g, prefer = "image") #> SpatExtent : 6400.029, 6900.037, -5150.007, -4699.967 (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax)  # add a dummy image with different spatial extent r <- terra::rast(array(seq(25), dim = c(5, 5))) test <- createGiottoLargeImage(r) ext(test) <- c(1e5, 1.1e5, 0, 10) g <- setGiotto(g, test) # add image  # combined from all image objects ext(g, prefer = "image", name = list(images = list_images_names(g))) #> SpatExtent : 6400.029, 110000, -5150.007, 10 (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax)  # combined from all spatial data types in giotto object ext(g, all_data = TRUE, name = list(images = list_images_names(g))) #> SpatExtent : 6391.46568586489, 110000, -5153.89721175534, 10 (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax)  # spatLocsObj %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%% sl <- getSpatialLocations(g) ext(sl) #> SpatExtent : 6402.43781589887, 6899.20308651186, -5146.72565198022, -4700.15708342436 (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax)  # giottoPolygon %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%% # get extent gpoly <- getPolygonInfo(g, return_giottoPolygon = TRUE) ext(gpoly) #> SpatExtent : 6399.24384990901, 6903.24298517207, -5152.38959073896, -4694.86823300896 (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax)  # set extent plot(gpoly) # before  ext(gpoly) <- ext(0, 20, 30, 60) plot(gpoly) # after   # giottoPoints %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%% # get extent gpoints <- getFeatureInfo(g, return_giottoPoints = TRUE) ext(gpoints) #> SpatExtent : 6400.037, 6900.0317, -5149.9834, -4699.9785 (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax)  # set extent plot(gpoints) # before  ext(gpoints) <- ext(0, 2000, 3000, 6000) plot(gpoints) # after

title: S4 giotto Class — giotto-class
text: [initialize] giotto class robust initialize() method automatically called upon setting data object, updates giottoInstructions, loading saved objects. performs following steps: Update object subobjects class definition changes needed Ensure set giottoInstructions available, otherwise generate defaults Ensure giotto python environment accessible options giotto.has_conda giotto.use_conda TRUE Check active spat_unit feat_type Ensure spatial/cell ID consistency initialize cell_ID feat_ID slots active spat_unit feat_type, well cell feature metadata exist. Values IDs metadata pulled existing data spatial_info/feat_info expression slots, preference latter. Perform slot-specific hierarchical checks ensure dependent pieces information added data depend existing information consistent across slots. Object validity checking

code: g <- GiottoData::loadGiottoMini("visium") #> 1. read Giotto object #> 2. read Giotto feature information #> 3. read Giotto spatial information #> 3.1 read Giotto spatial shape information #> 3.2 read Giotto spatial centroid information #> 3.3 read Giotto spatial overlap information #> 4. read Giotto image information #> python already initialized in this session #>  active environment : 'giotto_env' #>  python version : 3.10 #> checking default envname 'giotto_env' #> a system default python environment was found #> Using python path: #>  "/usr/share/miniconda/envs/giotto_env/bin/python"  # create instructions ins <- instructions() #> python already initialized in this session #>  active environment : 'giotto_env' #>  python version : 3.10 #> checking default envname 'giotto_env' #> a system default python environment was found #> Using python path: #>  "/usr/share/miniconda/envs/giotto_env/bin/python"  # get instructions instrs <- instructions(g) force(instrs) #> <giottoInstructions> #> python_path      : /usr/share/miniconda/envs/giotto_env/bin/python #> show_plot        : TRUE #> return_plot      : FALSE #> save_plot        : FALSE #> save_dir         : NA #> plot_format      : png #> dpi              : 300 #> units            : in #> height           : 9 #> width            : 9 #> is_docker        : FALSE #> active_spat_unit : cell #> active_feat_type : rna  # get single instructions param instructions(g, "show_plot") #> [1] TRUE  # replace an instruction param instructions(g, "show_plot") <- FALSE instructions(g, "show_plot") #> [1] FALSE  # replace multiple instruction params instructions(g) #> <giottoInstructions> #> python_path      : /usr/share/miniconda/envs/giotto_env/bin/python #> show_plot        : FALSE #> return_plot      : FALSE #> save_plot        : FALSE #> save_dir         : NA #> plot_format      : png #> dpi              : 300 #> units            : in #> height           : 9 #> width            : 9 #> is_docker        : FALSE #> active_spat_unit : cell #> active_feat_type : rna instructions(g, c("show_plot", "dpi")) <- list(TRUE, 600) instructions(g) #> <giottoInstructions> #> python_path      : /usr/share/miniconda/envs/giotto_env/bin/python #> show_plot        : TRUE #> return_plot      : FALSE #> save_plot        : FALSE #> save_dir         : NA #> plot_format      : png #> dpi              : 600 #> units            : in #> height           : 9 #> width            : 9 #> is_docker        : FALSE #> active_spat_unit : cell #> active_feat_type : rna  # replace instructions i <- createGiottoInstructions() #> python already initialized in this session #>  active environment : 'giotto_env' #>  python version : 3.10 #> checking default envname 'giotto_env' #> a system default python environment was found #> Using python path: #>  "/usr/share/miniconda/envs/giotto_env/bin/python" instructions(g) <- i instructions(g) #> <giottoInstructions> #> python_path      : /usr/share/miniconda/envs/giotto_env/bin/python #> show_plot        : TRUE #> return_plot      : TRUE #> save_plot        : FALSE #> save_dir         : /home/runner/work/GiottoClass/GiottoClass/docs/reference #> plot_format      : png #> dpi              : 300 #> units            : in #> height           : 9 #> width            : 9 #> is_docker        : FALSE #> active_spat_unit : cell #> active_feat_type : rna

title: Giotto python environment — giotto_python
text: Giotto several functions utilize python packages. facilitate , utilities provided creating, removing, attaching python environments. Python environments currently handled entirely reticulate. Creating environment installGiottoEnvironment() can used create default miniconda environment called giotto_env includes commonly used python packages. See python versions section specific packages version numbers. Custom environments manageable reticulate also compatible can hooked Giotto creation. checkGiottoEnvironment() can used order test envname full python path accessible Giotto. also check "giotto.py_path" option. Choosing environments one python environment may initialized used reticulate single R session. order switch another environment, R session must restarted. Whenever following happens first time session: giotto object creation (due creation default giottoInstructions) giottoInstructions creation (createGiottoInstructions()) GiottoClass::set_giotto_python_path() called (direct) , Giotto automatically detects activates python environment based following defaults decreasing priority: User provided (python_path param NULL) provided path envname option "giotto.py_path" Default expected giotto environment location based reticulate::miniconda_path() Envname "giotto_env" System default python environment behavior mediated set_giotto_python_path() utility function, find environment initialize .

text: gobject_list list giotto objects gobject_names unique giotto names giotto object join_method method join giotto objects, see details z_vals distance(s) along z-axis method z-stack (default step 1000) x_shift numeric vector values shift along x-axis method "shift" y_shift numeric vector values shift along y-axis method "shift" x_padding x padding datasets method shift y_padding y padding datasets method shift. applied y shifts given. dry_run logical. Plot expected object locations join, actually perform . verbose verbose Preview gobject space bounding polygons

title: Join giotto objects — joinGiottoObjects
text: giotto object

title: Join giotto objects — joinGiottoObjects
text: function joins expression spatial information multiple giotto objects single one. Giotto supports multiple ways joining spatial information selected param join_method: "shift" (default) Spatial locations different datasets shifted numeric vectors values supplied x_shift, y_shift, x_padding, y_padding. particularly useful data provided tiles ROIs analyzing multiple spatial datasets together keeping spatial data separate. shift values given value needed giotto object joined gobject_list. Order matters. regular step value desired instead specific list values, use x_padding y_padding. shift padding values can used time. x_shift NULL, defaults x range gobjects list datasets xshifted exactly next overlaps. additional default x_padding = 1000 applied x_shift, x_padding, y_shift, y_padding NULL. "z_stack" Datasets spatially combined change x y spatial locations, z value incorporated dataset based input supplied param z_vals. specify z value dataset join, numeric vector must given value element gobject_list. Order matters. Alternatively, single numeric value can supplied z_vals case input treated z step value. "no_change" changes applied spatial locations datasets joining.

title: Join giotto objects — joinGiottoObjects
code: # joining objects with no spatial information m1 <- matrix(rnorm(100), nrow = 10) m2 <- matrix(rnorm(100), nrow = 10) colnames(m1) <- paste0("cell_", seq_len(10)) colnames(m2) <- paste0("cell_", seq_len(10)) rownames(m1) <- rownames(m2) <- paste0("feat_", seq_len(10))  g1 <- createGiottoObject(expression = m1) #> python already initialized in this session #>  active environment : 'giotto_env' #>  python version : 3.10 #> checking default envname 'giotto_env' #> a system default python environment was found #> Using python path: #>  "/usr/share/miniconda/envs/giotto_env/bin/python" #> There are non numeric or integer columns for the spatial location #>  input at column position(s): 1 #>  The first non-numeric column will be considered as a cell ID #>  to test for consistency with the expression matrix #>  Other non numeric columns will be removed g2 <- createGiottoObject(expression = m2) #> python already initialized in this session #>  active environment : 'giotto_env' #>  python version : 3.10 #> checking default envname 'giotto_env' #> a system default python environment was found #> Using python path: #>  "/usr/share/miniconda/envs/giotto_env/bin/python" #> There are non numeric or integer columns for the spatial location #>  input at column position(s): 1 #>  The first non-numeric column will be considered as a cell ID #>  to test for consistency with the expression matrix #>  Other non numeric columns will be removed  joinGiottoObjects(     gobject_list = list(g1, g2),     gobject_names = c("g1", "g2") ) #> An object of class giotto  #> >Active spat_unit:  cell  #> >Active feat_type:  rna  #> dimensions    : 10, 20 (features, cells) #> [SUBCELLULAR INFO] #> [AGGREGATE INFO] #> expression ----------------------- #>   [cell][rna] raw #> spatial locations ---------------- #>   [cell] raw #>  #>  #> Use objHistory() to see steps and params used  # dry run joining objects with spatial information # a default x_padding of 1000 is applied viz <- GiottoData::loadGiottoMini("viz") #> 1. read Giotto object #> 2. read Giotto feature information #> 3. read Giotto spatial information #> 3.1 read Giotto spatial shape information #> 3.2 read Giotto spatial centroid information #> 3.3 read Giotto spatial overlap information #> 4. read Giotto image information #> python already initialized in this session #>  active environment : 'giotto_env' #>  python version : 3.10 #> checking default envname 'giotto_env' #> a system default python environment was found #> Using python path: #>  "/usr/share/miniconda/envs/giotto_env/bin/python" joinGiottoObjects(     list(viz, viz),     gobject_names = c("v1", "v2"),     dry_run = TRUE )   # place them right next to each other # note that this means generated spatial networks will be more likely to # link across the datasets joinGiottoObjects(     list(viz, viz),     gobject_names = c("v1", "v2"),     dry_run = TRUE,     x_padding = 0 )   # join the spatial objects joined_viz <- joinGiottoObjects(     list(viz, viz),     gobject_names = c("v1", "v2") ) #> Warning: spatial locations have been modified. #>  Relevant spatial networks may need to be #>  regenerated #> Warning: spatial locations have been modified. #>  Relevant spatial networks may need to be #>  regenerated #> Warning: spat_unit: z1 spatloc name: raw #>  cell IDs in spatial locations are missing from spatial #>  polygon info #> Warning: spat_unit: aggregate spatloc name: raw #>  cell IDs in spatial locations are missing from spatial #>  polygon info

code: g <- GiottoData::loadGiottoMini("visium") #> 1. read Giotto object #> 2. read Giotto feature information #> 3. read Giotto spatial information #> 3.1 read Giotto spatial shape information #> 3.2 read Giotto spatial centroid information #> 3.3 read Giotto spatial overlap information #> 4. read Giotto image information #> python already initialized in this session #>  active environment : 'giotto_env' #>  python version : 3.10 #> checking default envname 'giotto_env' #> a system default python environment was found #> Using python path: #>  "/usr/share/miniconda/envs/giotto_env/bin/python" td <- tempdir() saveGiotto(gobject = g, dir = td) #> 1. Start writing feature information #> 2. Start writing spatial information #> For spatial information: cell #> 3. Start writing image information #> For image information: alignment #> For image information: image  loadGiotto(path_to_folder = paste0(td, "/saveGiottoDir")) #> 1. read Giotto object #> 2. read Giotto feature information #> 3. read Giotto spatial information #> 3.1 read Giotto spatial shape information #> 3.2 read Giotto spatial centroid information #> 3.3 read Giotto spatial overlap information #> 4. read Giotto image information #> python already initialized in this session #>  active environment : 'giotto_env' #>  python version : 3.10 #> checking default envname 'giotto_env' #> a system default python environment was found #> Using python path: #>  "/usr/share/miniconda/envs/giotto_env/bin/python" #> An object of class giotto  #> >Active spat_unit:  cell  #> >Active feat_type:  rna  #> dimensions    : 634, 624 (features, cells) #> [SUBCELLULAR INFO] #> polygons      : cell  #> [AGGREGATE INFO] #> expression ----------------------- #>   [cell][rna] raw normalized scaled #> spatial locations ---------------- #>   [cell] raw #> spatial networks ----------------- #>   [cell] Delaunay_network spatial_network #> spatial enrichments -------------- #>   [cell][rna] cluster_metagene DWLS #> dim reduction -------------------- #>   [cell][rna] pca custom_pca umap custom_umap tsne #> nearest neighbor networks -------- #>   [cell][rna] sNN.pca custom_NN #> attached images ------------------ #> images      : alignment image  #>  #>  #> Use objHistory() to see steps and params used

title: Preview a Giotto spatial object — plot-generic
text: x giotto image, giottoPolygon, giottoPoints object y used. ... additional parameters pass col character. Colors. default grDevices::grey.colors(n = 256, start = 0, end = 1, gamma = 1) max_intensity (optional) value treat maximum intensity color scale mar numeric vector length 4 set margins plot (make space legend). default (3, 5, 1.5, 1) asRGB (optional) logical. Force RGB plotting automatically detected legend logical character. FALSE legend drawn. character value can used indicate legend drawn. example "topright" "bottomleft" axes logical. Draw axes? maxcell positive integer. Maximum number cells use plot smooth logical. TRUE cell values smoothed point_size size points plotting giottoPoints type plot: either 'poly' (default) polygon 'centroid' max_poly numeric. type specified, maximum number polygons plot automatically switching centroids plotting. Default 1e4. value settable using options("giotto.plot_max_poly") feats specific features plot within giottoPoints object (defaults NULL, meaning available features) raster default = TRUE, whether plot points rasterized plot size based raster_size param. See details. FALSE, plots via terra::plot() raster_size Default 600. used raster TRUE dims dimensions plot

title: Preview a Giotto spatial object — plot-generic
text: plot

title: Preview a Giotto spatial object — plot-generic
text: [giottoPoints raster plotting] Fast plotting points information rasterizing information using terra::rasterize(). terra SpatVectors, faster scattermore plotting. plotting raster, col colors map whole image level, opposed mapping individual points, raster = FALSE Allows following additional params plotting specific feats input: force_size logical. raster_size param caps 1:1 spatial extent, also minimum resulting px dim 100. ignore constraints, set force_size = FALSE dens logical. Show point density using count statistic per rasterized cell. (Default = FALSE). param affects col param defaults. TRUE, col grDevices::hcl.colors(256). FALSE, "black" "white" used. background (optional) background color. Usually used col color mapping sufficient. Note col param base::plot() graphical params available ...

title: Preview a Giotto spatial object — plot-generic
code: ######### giottoLargeImage plotting ######### if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ gimg <- GiottoData::loadSubObjectMini("giottoLargeImage") gimg <- GiottoClass:::.update_giotto_image(gimg) # only needed if out of date plot(gimg) plot(gimg, col = grDevices::hcl.colors(256)) plot(gimg, max_intensity = 100) } # }  ######### giottoPolygon plotting ######### gpoly <- GiottoData::loadSubObjectMini("giottoPolygon") plot(gpoly)  plot(gpoly, type = "centroid")   ######### giottoPoints plotting ######### gpoints <- GiottoData::loadSubObjectMini("giottoPoints")  # ----- rasterized plotting ----- # # plot points binary plot(gpoints)  # plotting all features maps colors on an image level plot(gpoints, col = grDevices::hcl.colors(n = 256)) # only 2 colors are used  plot(gpoints, col = "green", background = "purple")   # plot points density (by count) plot(gpoints, dens = TRUE, raster_size = 300)   # force_size = TRUE to ignore default constraints on too big or too small # (see details) plot(gpoints, dens = TRUE, raster_size = 80, force_size = TRUE)   # plot specific feature(s) plot(gpoints, feats = featIDs(gpoints)[seq_len(4)])   # ----- vector plotting ----- # # non-rasterized plotting (slower, but higher quality) plot(gpoints, raster = FALSE)   # vector plotting maps colors to transcripts plot(gpoints, raster = FALSE, col = grDevices::rainbow(nrow(gpoints)))   # plot specific feature(s) plot(gpoints, feats = featIDs(gpoints)[seq_len(4)], raster = FALSE)   ######### spatLocsObj plotting ######### sl <- GiottoData::loadSubObjectMini("spatLocsObj") plot(sl)   ######### dimObj plotting ######### d <- GiottoData::loadSubObjectMini("dimObj") plot(d)  plot(d, dims = c(3, 5))

code: # stamp shapes hex <- hexVertices(radius = 1) spatlocs <- data.table::data.table(     sdimx = rnorm(10, mean = 5, sd = 20),     sdimy = rnorm(10, mean = 5, sd = 20),     cell_ID = paste0("spot_", seq_len(10)) ) random_hex <- polyStamp(hex, spatlocs) #> 10 polygons generated random_hex_poly <- createGiottoPolygon(random_hex) #>   Selecting col "poly_ID" as poly_ID column #>   Selecting cols "x" and "y" as x and y respectively plot(random_hex_poly)   # make a grid of shapes e <- c(0, 1000, 0, 1000) tg <- triGrid(extent = e, ccd = 100, id_prefix = "bin_")  r <- rectVertices(dims = c(x = 60, y = 50))  rect_grid_dt <- polyStamp(stamp_dt = r, spatlocs = tg) #> 104 polygons generated rect_poly <- createGiottoPolygon(rect_grid_dt) #>   Selecting col "poly_ID" as poly_ID column #>   Selecting cols "x" and "y" as x and y respectively plot(rect_poly)

title: Spatial relationships between geometries — relate
text: x spatial object records test y spatial object records test relations relation character. One "intersects", "touches", "crosses", "overlaps", "within", "contains", "covers", "coveredby", "disjoint". "DE-9IM" string "FF*FF****". See wikipedia geotools doc pairs logical. TRUE two-column matrix returned indices cases requested relation TRUE. especially helpful dealing many geometries returned value generally much smaller na.rm logical. TRUE pairs=TRUE, geometries x related geometry y omitted output character. "data.table" "matrix". "data.table" possible pairs=TRUE use_names logical. TRUE, pairs=TRUE, output="data.table" IDs geometries used. ... additional args pass character. type spatial data giotto object relate. One "polygon", "spatlocs", "points" spat_unit spatial unit feat_type feature type spat_locs_name name spatlocs use = "spatlocs"

title: Spatial and feature IDs — spatIDs-generic
text: Get cell IDs (termed spatial IDs better reflect single-cell level) feature IDs giotto object subobject. [giotto object specific] applied giotto object, functions pull cell_ID feat_ID slots. values within slots updated whenever object data changed , importantly, whenever active spat_unit feat_type set (see activeSpatUnit() activeFeatType()). New values slots specific active spat_unit feat_type detected either subcellular level (giottoPolygon giottoPoints) aggregate level (expression matrix) data, preference latter exists. aware current behavior, values returned byspatIDs() featIDs() regarded minimal set expected IDs within giotto slots, always exact set ordering.

TRUE, subset param quoted substitute(). Set FALSE calling function, although may recommended since NSE output can unexpected used interactively. ... additional params pass used subset param. spatID(), pass spatValues(). featID(), currently pass fDataDT(). use_cache use cached IDs available (gpoly gpoints ) uniques return unique ID values (currently gpoly gpoints ) feat_type (optional) specify feature type

what: Spatially query polygons within Giotto object — spatQueryGiottoPolygons
title: Spatially query polygons within Giotto object — spatQueryGiottoPolygons
text: Recursively select polygons based list spatial filters. Results returned new polygon-based spatial unit selection information recorded associated cell metadata. final item provided param filters layer information queried.

title: Spatially query polygons within Giotto object — spatQueryGiottoPolygons
code: spatQueryGiottoPolygons(   gobject,   filters,   name = "query_polys",   feat_type = NULL,   clip = TRUE )

title: Spatially query polygons within Giotto object — spatQueryGiottoPolygons
text: gobject Giotto object filters list characters. Named list IDs query spatial filters names designate spatial unit use character values either '' vector cell_IDs use. name (optional) character. NULL, new spatial unit name generated results feat_type (optional) May changed future. Determines feature type metadata hierarchical selection information stored. clip boolean. Default = FALSE. Whether final round querying return polygons clipped polygons used select . TRUE, value must provided name param generate new spatial unit

title: Spatially query polygons within Giotto object — spatQueryGiottoPolygons
text: giottoPolygon

title: Spatially shift an object — spatShift
text: x object dx numeric. shift x axis dy numeric. shift y axis spat_unit character vector. spatial units affect feat_type character vector. feature types affect images character vector. Images affect. dz numeric. shift z axis copy_obj Default = TRUE ... additional params pass methods geom character. Named vector colnames x, y, (z) coordinate columns. Default c("sdimx", "sdimy", "sdimz")

title: Spin an object — spin
text: x object angle numeric. Angle rotation degrees x0 numeric. x-coordinate center rotation. Defaults center x val given. y0 numeric. y-coordinate center rotation. Defaults center y val given. spat_unit character vector. spatial units affect feat_type character vector. feature types affect (giottoPoints ). z0 spatLocsObj specific. Numeric. z-coordinate center rotation. Depending z data present, defaults either 0 center z val given. xy_angle spatLocsObj specific. xy plane rotation degrees. Overrides angle param zy_angle spatLocsObj specific. zy plane rotation xz_angle spatLocsObj specific. xz plane rotation geom character. Named vector colnames x, y, (z) coordinate columns. Default c("sdimx", "sdimy", "sdimz") ... additional params pass

title: Stitch multiple giottoLargeImage objects into a single giottoLargeImage object — stitchGiottoLargeImage
text: largeImage_list list giottoLargeImage objects gobject_list list gobjects containing giottoLargeImages largeImage_nameList list names giottoLargeImages within gobjects FOV_positions dataframe FOV positions. Values () directly added current image mapping FOV_xcol column name FOV position x values FOV_ycol column name FOV position y values FOV_inverty make FOV y position values negative method method stitching images (mosaic: average overlapping area values, merge:values get priority order images given) round_positions boolean. Round image positions. May necessary run. filename file name write stitched image . Defaults "save_dir/stitch.tif" save_dir param found first gobject's Giotto instructions dataType (optional) values dataType "INT1U", "INT2U", "INT2S", "INT4U", "INT4S", "FLT4S", "FLT8S". first three letters indicate whether dataType integer (whole numbers) real number (decimal numbers), fourth character indicates number bytes used (allowing large numbers /precision), "S" "U" indicate whether values signed (negative positive) unsigned (positive values ). fileType (optional) image format (e.g. .tif) given, defaults format given filename dryRun boolean. Plot placeholder bounding rectangles FOV images stitched without actually proceeding full image stitching saving process. overwrite boolean. Overwrite filename save image already exists. Defaults TRUE verbose boolean. verbose

FOV_positions parameter accepts table x y values FOV tile placed performing stitch. columns x y values determined FOV_xcol FOV_ycol params respectively. FOV tiles full resolution starting position either lower left upper left image touch origin depending value FOV_inverty param. FOV image translated according x y shift values.

title: Stitch multiple giottoLargeImage objects into a single giottoLargeImage object — stitchGiottoLargeImage
text: Many imaging systems may treat origin according image convention (0,0) upper left image. odds coordinate convention Giotto uses internally coordinate (0,0) lower left. FOV_inverty defaults FALSE, set TRUE, FOV tile images start upper left touching (0,0) y values given FOV_positions FOV_ycol treated negative y shift values.

title: Tessellated grid of polygons — tessellate
text: function generates tessellated grid spatial locations based input spatial locations. shape tessellation grid can either hexagonal square. shape_size parameter determines size grid cells bin size.

title: Tessellated grid of polygons — tessellate
code: # Create an extent across which to generate tessellated polygons e <- ext(0, 100, 0, 100) # produce hexagons with a diameter of 10 x <- tessellate(extent = e, shape = "hexagon", shape_size = 10) #> 104 polygons generated plot(x)   # same size grid, but now with a gap x <- tessellate(extent = e, shape = "hexagon", shape_size = 10, gap = 1) #> 104 polygons generated plot(x)   # square grid with a gap x <- tessellate(extent = e, shape = "square", shape_size = 10, gap = 1) #> 100 polygons generated plot(x)

[, [[, $, $<-, subset() giotto see ?GiottoClass::subset_giotto subset spatIDs() featIDs() objName(), spatUnit(), featType() generics now return NA_character_ instead erroring used unsupported classes. ext() ext<-() can now used get set extent affine2d rownames(), colnames(), dimnames() giotto spatValues() can get values multiple spatial units. createGiottoPolygonsFromMask() now works anything terra::rast() can read createGiottoLargeImage() now works anything terra::rast() can read
